intro: Tabernaemontana collina, commonly known as the mountain tabernaemontana, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Tabernaemontana collina thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
